Package io.github.frc5024.lib5k.control_loops.statespace.wrappers

Class RangeFinderElevatorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.frc5024.lib5k.control_loops.statespace.wrappers.EncoderElevatorController
      • io.github.frc5024.lib5k.control_loops.statespace.wrappers.RangeFinderElevatorController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SystemCharacteristics, StateSpaceSystem
    @Untested
public class RangeFinderElevatorController
extends EncoderElevatorController
    This is a wrapper around a state space plant, observer, motion profiling, and LQR. The EncoderElevatorController class is designed to allow grade 9, and new programmers to make use of state space-based elevator control without having to worry about the actual math happening BTS. This controller is specially for controlling elevators that use a rangefinder. Use of a rangefinder is recommended by many teams. See for information on the math going on here: https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf#%5B%7B%22num%22%3A39%2C%22gen%22%3A0%7D%2C%7B%22name%22%3A%22XYZ%22%7D%2C85.04%2C391.42%2Cnull%5D

    • Constructor Detail

      • RangeFinderElevatorController

        public RangeFinderElevatorController​(DCBrushedMotor motorType,
                                     double carriageMassKg,
                                     double carriageMaxVelocityMPS,
                                     double carriageMaxAccelerationMPSSquared,
                                     double positionEpsilonM,
                                     double velocityEpsilonMPS)
        Create a RangeFinderElevatorController
        Parameters:
        motorType - The type of motor(s) used to drive the flywheel
        carriageMassKg - The mass of the carriage in Kg
        carriageMaxVelocityMPS - The maximum upward velocity of the carriage at max voltage
        carriageMaxAccelerationMPSSquared - The maximum upward acceleration of the carriage at max voltage as m/s^2
        positionEpsilonM - Position epsilon in meters
        velocityEpsilonMPS - Velocity epsilon in meters/second

      • RangeFinderElevatorController

        public RangeFinderElevatorController​(DCBrushedMotor motorType,
                                     double carriageMassKg,
                                     double carriageMaxVelocityMPS,
                                     double carriageMaxAccelerationMPSSquared,
                                     double modelPositionAccuracyM,
                                     double modalVelocityAccuracyMPS,
                                     double rangefinderAccuracy,
                                     double expectedLoopTimeSeconds,
                                     double positionEpsilonM,
                                     double velocityEpsilonMPS,
                                     double maxVoltageOutput)
        Create a RangeFinderElevatorController
        Parameters:
        motorType - The type of motor(s) used to drive the flywheel
        carriageMassKg - The mass of the carriage in Kg
        carriageMaxVelocityMPS - The maximum upward velocity of the carriage at max voltage
        carriageMaxAccelerationMPSSquared - The maximum upward acceleration of the carriage at max voltage as m/s^2
        modelPositionAccuracyM - How accurate we think the model's position control is in meters
        modalVelocityAccuracyMPS - How accurate we think the model's velocity control is in meters/second
        rangefinderAccuracy - The accuracy of the rangefinder in meters
        expectedLoopTimeSeconds - The loop period of the caller in seconds. This is generally 0.02 (20ms)
        positionEpsilonM - Position epsilon in meters
        velocityEpsilonMPS - Velocity epsilon in meters/second
        maxVoltageOutput - The maximum voltage to output. This is generally 12.0
